sentences.sentence: The Farmer and the Nightingale( 夜莺 )
A farmer lay listening to a nightingale( 夜莺 )’s song throughout( 在整个期间 ) one summer night.
He was so pleased with it that the next night he set a trap( 陷阱 ) for it and caught it.
“Now I have caught you,” he cried, “and you will always sing to me.”
“We nightingales( 夜莺 ) never sing in a cage( 笼子 ),” said the bird.
“Then I’ll eat you,” said the farmer.
“I have always heard that a nightingale( 夜莺 ) on toast( 吐司 ) is delicious.”
“No, don’t kill me,” said the nightingale( 夜莺 );
“but set me free, and I’ll tell you three things worth much more than my poor body.”
The farmer let him loose, and he flew up to a branch( 树枝 ) of a tree and said,
“Never believe a prisoner( 囚犯 )’s promise; that’s one thing.
Then again: keep what you have.
And third piece of advice is: do not waste your sadness on what is lost forever( 永远 ).”
Then the song-bird flew away.
MORAL: If you love someone, set them free.
The Farmer and the Snake
A snake, having made his hole close to a farmer’s small house, bit and killed the farmer’s young son.
Angry over his loss, the farmer decided to kill the snake.
The next day, when it came out of its hole for food,
he took up his ax, but by swinging( 挥动 ) too quickly, missed its head and cut off only the end of its tail.
After some time the farmer, afraid that the snake would bite him also,
tried to make peace, and placed some bread and salt in the hole.
The snake, slightly hissing( 发嘶嘶声 ), said, “There can never be peace between us;
for whenever I see you I shall remember the loss of my tail,
and whenever you see me you will be thinking of the death of your son.”
MORAL: It is very hard to forgive( 原谅 ) those whom we see every day.
The Farmer and the Stork( 鹳 )
A farmer set some traps( 陷阱 ) in a field which he had recently sown( 播种 ) with corn,
in order to catch the cranes( 鹤 ) which came to pick up( 啄食 ) the seed( 种子 ).
When he returned to look at his traps( 陷阱 ) he found several cranes( 鹤 ) caught,
and among them a stork( 鹳 ), which begged( 乞求 ) to be let go, and said,
“Please don’t kill me: I am not a crane( 鹤 ), but a stork( 鹳 ),
as you can easily see by my feathers( 羽毛 ), and I am the most honest and harmless of birds.”
But the farmer replied, “I don’t care what you are:
I find you among these cranes( 鹤 ), who ruin my crops( 庄稼 ), and, like them, you shall suffer( 吃苦头 ).”
MORAL: Be careful—you will be judged( 被评价 ) by the company you keep.
The Flies and the Honey( 蜂蜜 ) Pot( 罐子 )
Some flies were attracted( 被吸引 ) to a pot( 罐子 ) of honey( 蜂蜜 ) which had fallen over.
Standing in the honey( 蜂蜜 ), they started eating greedily( 贪婪地 ).
Their feet, however, became so covered in honey( 蜂蜜 ) that they could not use their wings, or break free, and so died.
Just as they were dying, they said,
“Oh, foolish( 愚蠢的 ) creatures( 生物 ) we are.
For a little pleasure, we have destroyed( 毁灭 ) ourselves.”
MORAL: Being too greedy( 贪婪的 ) for pleasure often leads to pain.

question.cn: 在故事The Farmer and the Nightingale中，农夫为什么要设计陷阱把夜莺抓起来？
question.en: Why did the farmer set a trap to catch the nightingale in the story The Farmer and the Nightingale?

options.en: He wanted to eat the nightingale.

options.cn: 他想要夜莺每天给他唱歌。
options.en: He wished the nightingale to sing to him every day.
He thought the nightingale was too noisy.

analysis: 文中提到：“He was so pleased with it. . . now I have caught you. . . and you will always sing to me ”可知，农夫很喜欢夜莺的声音，想让夜莺一直给他唱歌，所以设计陷阱把夜莺抓起来，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Farmer and the Nightingale中，农夫有没有吃夜莺？
question.en: Did the farmer eat the nightingale in the story the Farmer and the Nightingale?

analysis: 文中提到：“The farmer let him loose.”可知，最后农夫释放了夜莺，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Farmer and the Snake中，为什么农夫想要杀掉蛇？
question.en: In the story the Farmer and the Snake, why did the farmer want to kill the snake?

options.en: He thought the snake was dangerous.
His son was killed by the snake.
He was afraid that the snake would kill him.

analysis: 文中提到：“The snake bit and kill the farmer’s young son, angry over his loss, the farmer decided to kill the snake.” 蛇杀死了农夫的儿子，农夫想帮他儿子报仇，所以要杀蛇，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Farmer and the Stork中，农夫最后把鹳放走了吗？
question.en: In the story the Farmer and the Stork, did the farmer let the stork go?

analysis:
文中农夫说道：“ I don’t care what you are: I find you among these cranes, who
ruin my crops, and, like them, you shall suffer.”可知，农夫决定像对待鹤一样，不会放掉这只鹳，因此本题选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Flies and the Honey Pot中，苍蝇的结局是什么？
question.en: In the story the Flies and the Honey Pot, what happened to the flies?

options.en: They finished eating and flew away.
They got stuck in the honey and died.

analysis: 文中提到：“Their feet, however, became so covered in honey that they could not use their wings, or break free, and so died.”可见，苍蝇最后死了，因此选C。
